name: Great Wall of China
facts: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications built along the northern borders of China to protect against invasions. It is over 13,000 miles long.

name: Christ the Redeemer
facts: Christ the Redeemer is a colossal statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is 98 feet tall, excluding its 26-foot pedestal.

name: Stonehenge
facts: Stonehenge is a prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England. It consists of a ring of standing stones, each around 13 feet high.

name: Eiffel Tower
facts: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower in Paris, France. It was constructed for the 1889 World's Fair and stands at 1,083 feet tall.

name: Mount Everest
facts: Mount Everest is Earth's highest mountain above sea level, located in the Himalayas. Its peak rises to 29,032 feet.

name: Sydney Opera House
facts: The Sydney Opera House is a multi-venue performing arts center in Sydney, Australia, known for its distinctive sail-like design.

name: Statue of Liberty
facts: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor. It was a gift from France to the United States in 1886.

name: Petra
facts: Petra is a historical and archaeological city in southern Jordan. Famous for its rock-cut architecture, it was the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom.

name: Mount Fuji
facts: Mount Fuji is an active stratovolcano and the highest peak in Japan at 12,389 feet. It is considered one of Japan's three sacred mountains.

name: Angkor Wat
facts: Angkor Wat is a massive temple complex in Cambodia. It is the largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple.

name: Alhambra
facts: The Alhambra is a palace and fortress complex in Granada, Spain. It is known for its stunning Islamic architecture and intricate gardens.

name: Grand Canyon
facts: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, USA. It is 277 miles long and up to 18 miles wide.

name: Mount Kilimanjaro
facts: Mount Kilimanjaro is a dormant volcano in Tanzania and the highest mountain in Africa at 19,341 feet above sea level.

name: Great Barrier Reef
facts: The Great Barrier Reef, located off the coast of Queensland, Australia, is the largest coral reef system in the world, spanning 1,400 miles.

name: Niagara Falls
facts: Niagara Falls is a group of three waterfalls at the border of Ontario, Canada, and New York, USA. The combined falls have the highest flow rate of any waterfall in North America.

name: Tower of London
facts: The Tower of London is a historic castle located on the north bank of the River Thames in central London. It was founded in 1066 as part of the Norman Conquest of England.

name: Palace of Versailles
facts: The Palace of Versailles is a former royal residence located in Versailles, France. It was the principal royal residence of France from 1682 until the French Revolution.

name: Burj Khalifa
facts: The Burj Khalifa is a skyscraper in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. It is the tallest structure in the world, standing at 2,717 feet tall.

name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
facts: Notre-Dame Cathedral is a medieval Catholic cathedral in Paris, France. It is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of French Gothic architecture.

name: Sagrada Familia
facts: The Sagrada Familia is a large unfinished Roman Catholic minor basilica in Barcelona, Spain. Designed by architect Antoni Gaud√≠, construction began in 1882 and is still ongoing.
